question: What is a perfectly black body?
option1: A body which absorbs all the radiations incident on it
option2: A body which has zero coefficient of linear expansion
option3: A body which has zero absorptive power
option4: A body painted black on all sides
answer: A body which absorbs all the radiations incident on it
explanation: A body which absorbs all the radiations incident on it is called a perfectly black body.
